abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column highlights One Win Leads to Another, Rio de Janeiro youth program started by International Olympic Committee and United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women; program aims to destigmatize sports for girls in Brazil while engaging them in discussions of gender issues and domestic violence.

headline.print_headline: Giving Girls a Chance to Play Ball
headline.main: In the Shadow of the Olympic Park, Women’s Sports Lag Behind

keywords.value: United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Women’s sports, even at the youth level, remain heavily stigmatized in Brazil. U.N. Women is trying to change that for a group of girls from Rio’s favelas....
lead_paragraph: Women’s sports, even at the youth level, remain heavily stigmatized in Brazil. U.N. Women is trying to change that for a group of girls from Rio’s favelas.
